title: Authorizes optometrists to prescribe certain drugs that may be used for therapeutic purposes and taken orally
summary: Authorizes optometrists certified to use therapeutic pharmaceutical agents for the treatment or prevention of ocular disease, to also use specified oral pharmaceutical agents in their practices; requires completion of a 25 hour phase three therapeutic pharmaceutical agent certification course of didactic education; permits the commissioner of health to recommend other categories of drugs that may also be prescribed.

    8    (II) DECONGESTANTS/ANTI-ALLERGENIC/ANTIHISTAMINES;

   11    (V) ANALGESICS, EXCEPT THOSE LISTED IN  SCHEDULES  I  AND  II  OF  THE
   12  UNIFORM CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES ACT;
   13    (VI) NONSTEROIDAL ANTI-INFLAMMATORY DRUGS;

   16  TWELVE OF THIS SECTION.

   18  education  law are relettered paragraphs (d) and (e) and a new paragraph

   22  TWO  THERAPEUTIC  PHARMACEUTICAL AGENTS AND HAVE COMPLETED A TWENTY-FIVE

    3  AND APPROVED BY THE DEPARTMENT, WHICH SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE  LIMITED

   11  AND (II) HAVE TAKEN AND SUCCESSFULLY PASSED  EITHER  THE  TREATMENT  AND

   25  HOUR  PHASE  THREE THERAPEUTIC PHARMACEUTICAL AGENT CERTIFICATION COURSE
   26  PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (C) OF SUBDIVISION FOUR OF THIS SECTION.
   27    S 4. Subdivision 7 of section 7101-a of the education law, as added by
   28  chapter 517 of the laws of 1995, is amended to read as follows:
   29    7. Continuing education. Each optometrist certified to use  phase  one
   30  or  phase two therapeutic pharmaceutical agents shall complete a minimum
   31  of thirty-six hours of continuing education per  triennial  registration
   32  period. The education shall be in the area of ocular disease and pharma-
   33  cology, AT LEAST SIX HOURS OF WHICH SHALL RELATE SPECIFICALLY TO SYSTEM-
   34  IC  DRUG USE AND INTERACTION, and may include both didactic and clinical
   35  components. Such educational programs shall be approved  in  advance  by

   38  section sixty-five hundred two of this chapter.

   41    12. Responsibilities of the commissioner of health.  The  commissioner
   42  of  health  may  recommend to the commissioner additions or deletions to
   43  the department's regulations relating to optometric use of drugs  except

   45  been determined to be equivalent to those drugs  already  authorized  or

   47  for their current use or for other similar reasons.   IN  ADDITION,  THE
   48  COMMISSIONER  OF HEALTH SHALL RECOMMEND TO THE COMMISSIONER ADDITIONS TO

   50  BEEN DETERMINED TO HAVE BECOME THE STANDARD OF CARE IN THE COMMUNITY FOR
   51  THE TREATMENT OF DISEASES OF THE EYE AND ADNEXA.

    1  THAT SUCH APPLICANT IS CERTIFIED IN CARDIOPULMONARY RESUSCITATION  (CPR)
